but can report it works perfectly now

if like most sane people you did not install xp on your system without using nlite to compact it and get rid of ms shit, you may find you cannot install this office 2007

you will get an error saying windows protected files cannot be updated

look in the event viewer under administrative tools on your start panel. read the message with red warning

it will tell you which file is the problem
in my case was fpault.dll
you need to find this file on your original xp cd, or download it, and copy it to the folder mentioned in the warning

in my case was prog files\common files\msshared\web extensions\40\bin

once you do that office will install fine

after that it is a question whether you want it. word is kind of ugly and overbearingly overloaded with crap

For the idiots & noobs that are just learning about torrents and .rar files:

1. Unrar
2. Read the.nfo file (right click and open in notepad if you don't have a 3rd party .nfo viewer like the cool kids do.
3. Go to wink-02k7e.rar  It's the only one that doesn't have .r## on it.  Right click and extract.
4. Using Nero or some other 3rd party burning software or a virtual drive, mount or burn the .cue

PROTIP:  You need both the .bin and .cue in the same folder to burn/mount the CD.


Now gtfo

This is for all you people who don't know how to extract a compressed file..

First double click the compressed file which will open it in winRAR..(i preffer this program so the instructions will pertain to it)

1. you will see a bunc of files from 00 up to 47 i believe..that is really irrelevant tho..just click them all then extract to whatever destanation folder you want.
2. once this is done click on the 00 file and press "view" on the top of the program. it will show a bin file..click on this and press extract.
3. it will cue you if you want to extract all files or just that one..press all the files. 
4. it will then give you an error saying a file is missing. click brouse and go to the file that you had extracted previously. 
5. you will see a one file in this folder press on it once and right click. press extract here. it will take another couple minutes to extract the file.
6. download daemon tools if you don't already have it.  right click on the dameon tool icon in your windows tray and go to the top to the drive E:
7. A drop down will pop up and give you the option of mounting. press "mount"
8. a window will pop up just brouse for the windows file that you extracted and double click on it. 
9. all done the windows office window should open.. just enter provided Key and your all set..

much love..

The reason for you .bc! extension is that you have downloaded the files using BitComet. BitComet automatically insert a ".bc!" after every filename, if you have selected that option. If the extension is still there, then you have not completely downloaded the file yet...
